metadata.title: CVE-2018-14612 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 4.17.10. There is aninvalid pointer dereference in btrfs_root_node() when mounting a craftedbtrfs image, because of a lack of chunk block group mapping validation inbtrfs_read_block_groups in fs/btrfs/extent-tree.c, and a lack of empty-treechecks in check_leaf in fs/btrfs/tree-checker.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14612` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-58-generic - 4.15.0-58.64
linux-image-4.15.0-58-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-58.64
linux-image-4.15.0-58-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-58-generic - 4.15.0-58.64
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-58-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1043-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1043.46
No subscription required
